title: OGM Check-in Call: Consciousness, Bubbles, and Cross-Connections

remixability.kevinMcLeod: Most prolific composer you've never heard of - 2,000 pieces of royalty-free music under Creative Commons
remixability.impact: One song played 31.6 billion times (TikTok, Facebook Reels)
remixability.conceptShift: Instead of making meals, make ingredients or recipes - things other people can and want to use to create things that are theirs
remixability.vs: Spending time creating something perfect and self-contained, never to be taken apart
remixability.implication: Create work that gives it a life of its own through remixing

growthMetaphors.problem: Traditional economics relies on growth, but living systems economics needs different growth framework
growthMetaphors.zeroSumVsAbundance: Tend to get trapped making things a little bit better, rarely positive sum abundance outcomes
growthMetaphors.economicsAsIndigenousKnowledge: Don't throw away traditional economics, think of it as indigenous knowledge - what can we learn from it?
growthMetaphors.sourdoughStory: Woman pioneers kept sourdough starter alive next to their breasts crossing mountains - sourdough growth as metaphor for living growth
growthMetaphors.question: What metaphors from biological systems around growth inform traditional economics in new ways?

foodWithThought.trigger: Union of Concerned Scientists 'yet another last urgent warning' - passing tipping points, will be ignored
foodWithThought.missingPiece: Transition to what can you actually do about this?
foodWithThought.agricultureOfTheMiddle: Small to medium-sized farmers can't get into market
foodWithThought.foodMostDamaging: Probably the most damaging part of our interaction with natural world - destroying watersheds, soils, biodiversity
foodWithThought.capacityToRegenerate: Has the capacity to recover, heal, regenerate
foodWithThought.largeCompanies: Monsanto, Nestle automating, 'climate smart technology', hugely capital intensive, will exclude more farmers
foodWithThought.secondaryCrop: Environmental benefits as second revenue stream - farmer has food crop + environmental benefit crop linked together
foodWithThought.examples: Mississippi Delta: reduce nitrogen runoff (easy to measure), incentives sufficient for conservative farmers
foodWithThought.leverage: By building secondary revenue stream, all other things fall into place - soil health, cover crops, no-till, rotation
foodWithThought.marketResistance: How easy it would be to make an impact, and how stubbornly resistant the market is to engage in change
foodWithThought.targetMarket: CSAs + farmers markets = only 3% of total sales. Get these farmers into wholesale market - bundling and aggregating

jerryPsilocybinJourney.context: First trip ever - never done drugs before
jerryPsilocybinJourney.setup: Friend in neighborhood, completely trustworthy, safe and lovely, grew shrooms himself, tested on himself
experience: Felt connected to mycelial networks of the world
Felt like 'I was everything all at once-ish'
Now understands special effects in movies - copying what happens when you see everything
Tried to leave 'little dorms or candles or gateways' to step back into experience without doing whole thing again
'Transformative... don't know how, but it was thrilling'

nonLocalConsciousness.danBrownBook: The Secret of Secrets - plot point is non-local consciousness
nonLocalConsciousness.sunilMalhotra: 1.5 years ago: 'What if consciousness isn't materialized from neurons, but is background radiation of universe? We occupy it, tune into it like radio station, when we die we meld back into it'
nonLocalConsciousness.jerryRealization: Already had non-local consciousness in brain from different research - same general idea
nonLocalConsciousness.noeticScience: Getting into woo-woo noetic science territory - beginning to respect a lot more
nonLocalConsciousness.GABA: Gamma-aminobutyric acid - primary inhibitor in neural system, high levels keep us from being overwhelmed
nonLocalConsciousness.lowGABA: Epilepsy - precipitous drop causes brain overwhelm and seizure, coming out: moments of bliss, connection with infinite
nonLocalConsciousness.hallucinogens: Seem to reduce GABA so you can perceive what's always happening around you - not generating hallucination, lowering filters
nonLocalConsciousness.timing: Read about GABA Tuesday night, had psilocybin journey Wednesday afternoon, check-in call Thursday

jerryPsilocybinJourney.mrRogers: April visited museum in Pittsburgh - Mr. Rogers told her 'you're okay just the way you are' during difficult childhood with mom, 'Kindness Zone' sign for the wall

aiBubble.wallStreetJournalDrumbeat: At least one article daily for last 3 weeks: 'Oh my god, it's an AI bubble!'
aiBubble.AOLparallel: Reminiscent of Time Warner bought by AOL - OpenAI is the AOL of our day, completely overinflated stock price
aiBubble.altmanStrategy: Doing exactly the right thing - using it to buy, do all sorts of deals that won't look good in 1-2 years
aiBubble.economyNowAI: Wall Street Journal: 'The U.S. economy is now AI' - all growth for 12+ months because of data center investment, take that out and economy's been flat
questions: Will it drag down just AI-related companies?
Will it drag down entire tech sector?
Will it drag down entire market?
Where do you put the money? (Gold up by factor of 3 because people confused)
How many thinking of pulling profits from tech investments?
aiBubble.mikesPosition: Cloudflare stock (employee 130 before IPO), IBM stock, tend to invest in what I know
aiBubble.handsPoll: Most raised hands: there's a bubble. 3.5 hands: changing investment strategy

peteWeirdTerritory.bigPicture: Been in a bubble since about PC era - one big tech bubble inflation thing going up and down, changing world and us
peteWeirdTerritory.aiAsEndgame: Feels like some kind of endgame - either amazing productivity and social justice, or crash hard because we've turned all matter into GPUs
peteWeirdTerritory.likelyOutcome: Some weird thing in the middle
peteWeirdTerritory.pastBubbles: 'It's hard to say this out loud to professional people who care, but it feels like we're kind of post cash/gold/Bitcoin questions'
peteWeirdTerritory.weirdTerritory: All of that seems like the wrong questions at this point. We're passed where we've even thought about bubbles. We're in weird territory.
peteWeirdTerritory.aiBackstop: Will AI backstop you? Won't it? Maybe great, but won't be able to eat - need to apply AI to growing things, delivering food, regenerative soil
peteWeirdTerritory.sheafMethodology: Mentioned in check-in - Alex interested in learning more

gilFinancialStrategy.notOneBubble: Not one big bubble, it's a series of bubbles - some stabilized, some not
gilFinancialStrategy.2008Parallel: Government bailed out some banks and not others - whole too-big-to-fail game, in another one now
gilFinancialStrategy.benHuntNumbers: Tech sector ~5% of GDP now pouring more money into economy than consumer sector ~30% of GDP - only thing keeping economy afloat
gilFinancialStrategy.maskingTariffs: Totally swamping effects of tariffs, whatever else might be happening
gilFinancialStrategy.microsoftDataCenters: 'Innovation at Microsoft' by Joanne Garvin - Data Center of the Future project, designed net-zero energy and net-zero water data centers
gilFinancialStrategy.areBuildingThem: Doesn't seem to be, theoretical possibility
gilFinancialStrategy.financialAdvice: Find your asset allocation strategy and stay there - rebalance periodically, that's how you move tech profits into other sectors
gilFinancialStrategy.gilDifference: Should be much more offshore than we are now - diversify out of US into international because of instability here

dougTabGroupsRevelation.problem: 250 tabs open across multiple browser windows, laptop overwhelmed, 'what do I do now' feeling
dougTabGroupsRevelation.discovery: Browser tab groups feature - never knew what it was called or where to find it
dougTabGroupsRevelation.transformation: Able to sort and bucket tabs into groups, close groups, close browser windows, freed up machine resources
dougTabGroupsRevelation.lifeChanging: Poor little laptop could function again, things started to flow, not be in overwhelm - 'This is life-changing for someone like me'
coreBeliefs: Every human being has value to add and contribute
What do each one of those individuals need in order to be enabled to contribute?
How do we meet everyone's needs?
Everything else substantially irrelevant if not germane to those inquiries
dougTabGroupsRevelation.capacityUnleashed: Tab groups unleashed flood tide of capacity - organizing, moving into action, unleashing the hounds
dougTabGroupsRevelation.ogmNexus: Touching bunch of projects - OGM people or people that have dipped in and out
dougTabGroupsRevelation.crossConnections: Starting to coalesce - two completely independent projects connect, Doug aware of both, aware of how they complement and fit larger context
dougTabGroupsRevelation.ogmCommon: List of about 12 projects, 60% have OGM in common
dougTabGroupsRevelation.hatTipJerry: Being the energetic center of gravity out of which a lot of these things connected with, met, and now coalesceable

dougDataCenterInsanity.observation: Rate at which energy technology, battery technology, quantum computing progressing
dougDataCenterInsanity.obsolescence: Massive billion-dollar data center investments obsolete in 18 months
dougDataCenterInsanity.doesntMakeSense: On intuitive logical level, it doesn't make sense. It's gotta blow up. When it's too good to be true, it defies reality.
dougDataCenterInsanity.layoffs: Biggest players canning 30, 40, 50K people to divert resource to constructing data centers
dougDataCenterInsanity.verdict: That's the end. Not the beginning of the end. Not a bubble. That's the end of whatever this has been.
dougDataCenterInsanity.insaneLogicalConclusion: Reached its insane logical conclusion as a capitalist train run amok
dougDataCenterInsanity.aftermath: Don't know what's after that, but I do know what's ending. Thank God. It needed to go away. We need to do us differently and better if we're not gonna go extinct.

alexInvestingAntiTalent.pattern: Always sold when I should have bought, and bought when I should have sold
alexInvestingAntiTalent.strategy: Few years back: keep 40% of money in pure cash because obviously market's gonna crash
alexInvestingAntiTalent.stillThere: It's still there. Haven't yet bought into the market.
alexInvestingAntiTalent.indicator: As soon as I'm tempted and buy the market, I will let all of you know - that is a time to get out
alexInvestingAntiTalent.cashProblem: Cash losing its value wherever you are (not in Swiss francs)
alexInvestingAntiTalent.mikeRelatability: Mike: 'I am in the same category you are' - sold shares that went on to 6x value
alexInvestingAntiTalent.blockchainParallel: In the throes of blockchain temperature 2015 - NVIDIA skyrocketed for Bitcoin mining cards
alexInvestingAntiTalent.obsolescenceEcho: Graphics cards became obsolete within 18 months (exactly as Doug said) - created backwash second-hand market for games
alexInvestingAntiTalent.datacenters: All these data centers becoming obsolete maybe produce cheap alternative computing power for something

emergingConnections.ogmAsGravitationalCenter: Doug: 12 projects, 60% have OGM in common, cross-connecting via individuals and conversations, Jerry as energetic center
emergingConnections.consciousnessExpansion: Jerry: Non-local consciousness (Sunil + Dan Brown) + psilocybin journey lowering GABA filters = seeing what's always there
emergingConnections.obsolescencePattern: Doug on data centers + Alex on blockchain NVIDIA cards: 18-month obsolescence cycle, second-hand markets
emergingConnections.beyondBubbles: Pete: We're past where we've thought about bubbles - weird territory, wrong questions. Doug: It's the end, not a bubble.
emergingConnections.growthReframe: David: Living systems growth (sourdough) vs traditional economics growth - need new metaphors
emergingConnections.secondaryRevenue: Klaus: Environmental benefits as second crop for farmers - leverage point that shifts entire system

checkInOrder.name: Klaus Mager
checkInOrder.topic: Food with Thought, environmental benefits as second crop

checkInOrder.name: Jerry Michalski
checkInOrder.topic: Mr. Rogers museum, non-local consciousness, first psilocybin journey

checkInOrder.name: Mike Nelson
checkInOrder.topic: AI bubble, investment strategy (didn't fully check in during check-in round, raised in conversation)

conversationPhase.description: Post-check-in discussion dominated by AI bubble and investment strategy
conversationPhase.mikeQuestion: Where do you put the money if divesting from tech?

responses.Gil: Asset allocation strategy and stay there, rebalance periodically, diversify offshore
responses.Pete: We're in weird territory past bubble questions, some weird outcome in the middle
responses.Doug: Data centers obsolete in 18 months, the end of capitalist train run amok
responses.Alex: 40% cash, will let everyone know when I buy (that's the signal to sell), blockchain NVIDIA obsolescence parallel
responses.Jerry: Too-big-to-fail territory, government put, timing is everything in bubbles

specialNotes: Jerry's first psychedelic experience ever - transformative psilocybin journey day before call
Non-local consciousness theme: Sunil Malhotra 1.5 years ago + Dan Brown's new book + Jerry's psilocybin experience all converging
Doug's 'OGM as energetic center of gravity' - 12 projects, 60% connected through OGM
AI bubble consensus - most hands up, but divergent perspectives on what it means
Pete's 'weird territory' - past where we've thought about bubbles
Doug's 18-month data center obsolescence paralleled by Alex's blockchain NVIDIA story
Klaus's 'stubbornly resistant market' vs clear solutions (environmental benefits as second crop)
Scott's remixability: ingredients/recipes instead of finished meals
David's sourdough growth metaphor for economics
Mr. Rogers role in April's childhood - 'you're okay just the way you are' when mom relationship difficult
emotionalTone: Transformative (Jerry), concerned (Mike on bubble), hopeful (Klaus on regenerative), reflective (Doug on enabling contribution), apocalyptic-but-relieved (Doug on end of capitalist train)

participationNotes.Jerry Michalski: Facilitator, shared MAJOR personal transformation (first psilocybin journey), non-local consciousness convergence, Mr. Rogers story
participationNotes.Scott Moehring: Remixability concept - create ingredients not finished meals, Kevin McLeod 31.6 billion plays
participationNotes.David Witzel: Growth metaphors from living systems to economics, sourdough starter story
participationNotes.Klaus Mager: Food with Thought progress, environmental benefits as second crop, market resistance
participationNotes.Mike Nelson: AI bubble drumbeat, investment strategy questions, Cloudflare position, three bubbles identified
participationNotes.Doug Breitbart: Tab groups life-changing, OGM gravitational center, data centers obsolete in 18 months, 'the end' verdict
participationNotes.Pete Kaminski: Sheaf methodology, weird territory past bubbles, AI as endgame
participationNotes.Gil Friend: Asset allocation strategy, Microsoft net-zero data centers, diversify offshore, Ben Hunt numbers
participationNotes.Alex Kladitis: Anti-investment talent, 40% cash, blockchain NVIDIA parallel, will signal when to sell

crossCallThemes: AI and tools (Calls 03, 10, now 14 with AI bubble)
OGM identity (Call 09 salon vs bodies of work → Call 14 Doug's gravitational center insight)
Klaus food systems (Call 06 → Call 14 Food with Thought progress)
Investment and economics (new focus in Call 14)
Growth questions (Call 09 OGM growth → Call 14 David's growth metaphors for economics)
Technology skepticism (Call 12 progress stopped → Call 14 AI bubble, Doug's data center end)
questionsRaised: What metaphors from biological growth inform economics? (David)
How do we transition from climate warnings to 'what can you actually do'? (Klaus)
Is there an AI bubble? (Mike - most hands up yes)
Will AI bubble drag down just AI, tech sector, or entire market? (Mike)
Where do you put money if divesting from tech? (Mike)
How do we meet everyone's needs to enable their contribution? (Doug)
Are massive data center investments obsolete in 18 months? (Doug - yes)
What comes after the end of the capitalist train run amok? (Doug)
Can we apply AI to regenerative agriculture before we can't eat? (Pete)
Should we diversify offshore because of US instability? (Gil)
